text:
RT @aveuaskew: Honey, does jelly go bad?

Jelly: Leave the door ajar! Can't you see it's jam packed in here? Lol

Wow, that's really bad
RT @Sassafrantz: The only time I regret not having a boyfriend is when the spider is bigger than my desire to be single.
RT @QwertyJones3: My favorite low sugar candy is sweetish fish.

3-year-old: *finishes watching "How the Grinch Stole Christmas"*

Me: What did you learn?

3-year-old: How to get all the presents.

My toddler stole bacon off my plate.

We all had a good laugh.

Then I made her move out.

Wife: You were up late last night. Are you feeling it today?

Me: Nah. I'm still young.

*closes eyes for 1 second*

*wakes up 4 days later*

Wife: You were smiling in your sleep. What were you dreaming about?

[flashback to me putting tiny hats on lobsters]

Me: Sex. Just sex.

Me: *puts on body armor*

*picks up brass knuckles*

*loads stun gun*

Wife: What are you doing?

Me: Getting ready for Black Friday.

[daughters point toy guns at me]

Me: Wouldn't you rather play with dolls or something?

5-year-old: Dolls don't kill zombies.

3-year-old: When will I learn to use the Force?

Me: Never. It's not real.

3-year-old: *rolls eyes* That's what you said about Santa.

Me: My Twitter friends are just like my real life friends

Wife: Will they help you move or have your back?

Me: No

Wife: They are the same

5-year-old: *sticks a pillow under her shirt*   I'm pregnant like mommy was.

Me: What happens now?

5-year-old: I yell at everyone.
Sisters: because you never know when you'll need covering fire https://t.co/JRwSO1gkdJ

3-year-old: I'm a bad Jedi.

Me: Do you remember what they're called?

3-year-old: The shit.

Me: What's my biggest weakness?

Wife: You ask questions but don't listen to the answer.

Me:

Wife:

Me: What's my biggest weakness?

Me: Lots of people like my tweets.

Wife: You mean robots pretending to be people?

Me:

Wife:

Me: Some are people pretending to be cats.

Me: Preschool isn't as bad as you're making it out to be.

3-year-old: They want me to know ALL of the colors.

Those bastards.

Wife: Is it snowing outside?

Me: Let me check.

*scrolls through Instagram*

Me: Have you seen my bathrobe?

3-year-old: *waves hand* No.

This isn't the bathrobe I'm looking for. https://t.co/NmC8ArYd5J

Me: Don’t drink bath water.

3-year-old: I have to clean my insides, too.

The baby farted so loudly she woke herself up.

At least now I'm sure she's mine.

[first snow of the year]

Kids: I hope we have a snow day!

Teachers: I hope we have a snow day!

Parents: FUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUCK

My wife spent tonight checking car seat expiration dates.

I made a margarita the size of a baby.

To each their own https://t.co/A5FctCmCFz

Me: Are you pooping?

18-month-old: *hiding behind the couch and grunting like a power lifter* No.

Wife: What do you do when nobody likes one of your tweets?

Me: I learn from it.

Wife: You must learn a lot.

My 3-year-old fell asleep on the floor when I said she has preschool today.

She had her first "I can't even" moment https://t.co/DYlKdFBnDl

5-year-old: Can I have some of the candy you hide on top of the fridge?

Me: What are the magic words?

5-year-old: I won't tell Mom.

5-year-old daughter: I played princesses today.

Me: So lots of balls and pretty dresses?

5: I mostly just sent people to the dungeon.

Me: What did you do at school?

5-year-old: Nothing

Me: You sat there for 8 hours & didn’t do a thing?

5: Yup.

She’s ready for a cubicle.

3-year-old: *puts a blanket over the baby*

Me: Aw, you covered her up.

3-year-old: Yeah. I don’t want to see her anymore.

5-year-old: The baby won't help clean up the house.

Me: She's a week old.

5-year-old: I know. She's been lazy long enough.

Me: Don't hit your sister.

5: I have to. I'm a Whomping Willow.

I was going to ground her, but instead I gave her 5 points for Gryffindor.

5-year-old: I love you 19.

Me: 19 what? That doesn't mean anything.

5-year-old: Never mind. I love you 18.

[playing Xbox online]

Other player: What's that sound?

Me: *holding a screaming baby on my lap* Probably static.

I love when people threaten to unfollow me if I don't meet their demands.

This is Twitter, not a hostage situation.

Feel free to fuck off.

Wife: What do you expect to gain from all the time you waste on Twitter?

Me: [imagines huge victory parade] Make a few friends, I guess.
My toddler found a bottle of Axe body spray I got as a free sample, and now she's wearing a Tapout T-shirt and calling everyone "bro."

Me: Anyone want to come with me to Pizza Hut?

3-year-old: I want to go on a pizza hunt!

Me:

3:

Me: Go grab the guns.

5-year-old daughter: I have a boyfriend.

Me: Aw, that's cute.

[10 years from now]

15-year-old: I have a boyfriend.

Me: THE HELL YOU DO.

Me: Why are you crying?

5-year-old: Because my sister is crying

Me: Why's she crying?

5: Because I'm crying

I'm done parenting for today
It's not really a party until someone passes out on the wood floor with a stuffed animal on their back. https://t.co/NozQDCZmdK

Doctor: No sex for 6 weeks after birth

Me: Why? Did her vagina see its shadow?

Doctor:

Me:

Doctor: Please tell me you're not the father.

3-year-old: The baby smells nice.

Me: She sure does.

3-year-old: Can we go smell other people?

She gets her social skills from me.

5-year-old: *tries to put a necklace on me*

Me: It won't fit.

5-year-old: Your fat head ruins everything.

You have no idea, kid.

I don't Netflix and chill.

I Netflix and children ruin everything.

Everyone asks what I'm going to do when all four of my daughters are teenagers.

I'm not worried at all.

I plan to be dead by then.

One girl was crying in this room before I stepped in to fix things.

Now there are three girls crying.

My parenting game is on point today.

Doctor: No sex for 6 weeks after birth.

Me: But mouth stuff is OK, right?

*doctor and wife exchange looks*

Doctor: No sex for 12 weeks.

My stages of hunger while eating:

Still hungry.

Still hungry.

Still hungry.

Still hungry.

Oh, God, I’m stuffed. Why did I eat so much?!

*confidently throws the empty macaroni box in the garbage because I don't need instructions*

*pulls the box back out 3 times to make sure*

[day drinking during "Harry Potter"]

Me: I'd do awesome at Professor Snape's class

Wife: Beer is not a magic potion

Me: Whatever, muggle.

I hate when people ask about the new baby.

I don't mind admitting she's my fourth girl.

I just don't like the evil cackling afterward.

Wife: We can't have sex for six weeks after birth.

Me: That's what the Internet is for.

*watches six weeks of funny cat videos*

Wife: First Cookie Crisp cereal. Now Reese's Peanut Butter Cup cereal. What's next?

Me: *patiently waits for Vodka-O's*

5-year-old: I'm really glad you're my dad.

Me: Why is that?

5-year-old: I don't know how to order pizza.

This is everything I bought at the drugstore.

Apparently I'm a single white woman. https://t.co/GwkD6Nbi0x
I'm getting day drunk and watching "Harry Potter," so, yes, adulthood is pretty much just like I imagined it.

Wife: You can't wear your Star Wars costumes outside.

5-year-old: Why?

Wife: Everyone will look at you.

5: Yeah. To see how cool we are.

Me: *watches a World War II documentary*

5-year-old: Was this before or after the dinosaurs?

Me: During.

*T. rex eats all the Nazis*

Mortal sins that will get you sent to hell:

3) adultery

2) murder

1) drinking coffee from a plain red cup

Me: What do you want the girls to wear today?

Wife: Dresses

Me: Which ones?

Wife: Just pick something.

Me: OK... https://t.co/sVMkez42Sk

3-year-old: How old do I have to be to drink beer?

Me: Old enough to realize your life sucks.
My favorite part of the Bible is when Jesus says fuck you if you don't put snowflakes on your coffee cups.

5-year-old: *holds up pic* This is my new baby sister.

Teacher: What do you like best about her?

5: She farted so loud she scared the dog.

Me: How long are you going to use childbirth as an excuse to make me do stuff?

Wife: Until you can give birth to your own damn babies.

Me: I bet I can take that bouncer.

Wife: That's a Walmart greeter.

Me: *can't hear her because I'm getting the shit kicked out of me*

The year is 2025.

Instagram is the most popular app in the world.

Restaurants are just food photography studios

Everyone starves to death

3-year-old: Dad, can you open this can of Sprite for me?

Me: We don't have any Sprite.

3-year-old: Yes we do. https://t.co/AR1aftt2X2

3: Someone broke the baby’s bellybutton.

Me: That’s her umbilical cord. It’s supposed to be like that.

3: Just remember I didn’t do it.

Me: Um, that outfit is way too big for her.

Wife: *demon voice* SHUT UP IT'S CUTE https://t.co/pNYXWbY8Fk

Wife: Can you move some stuff for me?

Me: I'm kind of sore from working out.

Wife: I pushed an entire person out of my vagina.

Checkmate.

[home with baby]

Me: *opens a celebration beer*

Wife: You don't have to drink the second we get back.

Me: Sorry.

*opens an apology beer*

“Is there a problem, ma’am?”

Instagram is down. Now what am I supposed to do with my food?

“Have you considered eating it?”

[every married conversation]

Wife: Did you see that post on Facebook?

Me: Yes. We have all the same friends

*resumes 40 years of silence*

3-year-old: *points to my wife's nipples* What are those?

Wife: They feed your baby sister.

3-year-old: Why? Are we out of Pop-Tarts?

Wife: I look bad in these pics with the baby

Me: You look like you always do

Wife:

Judging by this stab wound, that was the wrong answer.
I accidentally dripped some mustard on my newborn daughter’s forehead and long story short a nurse just walked in and saw me lick the baby.

Wife: They’re opening an IKEA store near us.

Me: Give me one second.

*buries our life savings in the yard so she can’t spend it*

My new baby sleeps all the time and only wakes up if she wants food.

She’s already a teenager.

My wife gave birth yesterday and is already refusing pain medication.

I'm still taking Ibuprofen from playing flag football last June.
"I don't know what kind of scam you're trying to pull here, new baby, but nobody is buying it." https://t.co/TgUpnSyggd

This pic took 85 tries.

Someday, those matching outfits will be the reason they put us in a terrible nursing home. https://t.co/4DHaeS4ekT

3-year-old: *stares at the baby* What does it do?

Me: Nothing yet. She's not here to entertain you.

3:

Me:

3: Can we get one that is?

Wife: Guess what.

Me: What?

Wife: I didn't poop myself during delivery.

Me:

Wife:

Me: *high-five*

So this basically just fell out of my wife and into the hands of a very surprised nurse.

Meet Waffle Breakwell. https://t.co/qbmKKp7L20

Wife: How dilated am I?

Nurse: *pulls back covers* Um, that's your baby's head.

Me: Hold up. I need to send this tweet.

So far today my wife prepared her body to push out a human.

I updated my fantasy football roster 4 times.

It's a big day for both of us.

My wife's speech patterns differently changed once the epidural went in.

That hardest part is telling if it's the drugs talking or Satan.

My wife says she does all the work during birth but here's all stuff I've done:
1) tweet
2) nap
3) tweet about napping
4) nap while tweeting

The happiest my wife has ever been to see a man:

3) her dad when she was born

2) me when we got married

1) the anesthesiologist right now

My wife said "gosh dang it" in the middle of a contraction.

Shit just got real.

Doctor: I'm going to break her water.

Me: *stands on a chair*

Doc: Seriously?

Me:

Doc: Wait, I remember you guys.

*rolls up pant legs*

My wife is out of it from the pain meds.

Not that I would take advantage of that.

Now if you'll excuse me, she said I could buy a goat.

Me: How dilated is she?

Nurse: 4 centimeters.

Me: This is America.

Nurse: 0.000198838 furlongs.

I learn something new with each birth

This time I learned it's not OK to call my wife's lady parts a baby cannon

I should write that down.

Nobody is awake to read my tweets at 3:45 AM on a Monday.

Apparently I'm followed by adults who make responsible life choices.

Fuck.

My pregnant wife made me adjust the thermostat 9 times in the last 2 minutes.

I can't get the room to be exactly 73.25°

I'm such a failure

Maybe there is no baby

I'm starting to suspect my wife's been stuffing her shirt with an increasingly large series of hams

Now I'm hungry.

My wife is still asleep, so I'm thinking no baby until morning.

Unless babies only attack when your defenses are down

Then expect one now.

It's alarming how many of these nurses recognize us from previous births.

The good news is with every fourth baby we get a free snow cone.

My wife fell asleep in the middle of labor.

It's like she doesn't know the rest of us are waiting on her.

Pregnant women are the worst.

A woman I've never seen before casually walked into the room and stuck her hand inside my wife's vagina.

I really hope she works here.

Wife: Are you still tweeting about me being in labor?

Me: Now I’m live tweeting “The Walking Dead.”

Wife:

Me: Everything isn’t about you.

The TV in this hospital room doesn’t have a DVR.

Now I can’t fast forward through the commercials during “The Walking Dead”

Thanks, Obama.

My mom: *calls* Any news?

Me: Yeah. I'm killing it on Twitter

Mom: No, any news about your pregnant wife?

Me: How the hell should I know?

Me:*drops full cup of water*

Pregnant wife: How are you gonna hold a baby?

Me: I've never dropped a kid

Wife:

Me: When you were watching

Me: How are your contractions?

Wife: Getting stronger

Me: Well, Walking Dead is at 9, so...

Wife:

Me: Just cross your legs or something.

Me: *looking over the hospital menu* They have personal pan pizzas! We should have a baby every year.

Wife:

Me: Every other year.

[maternity ward]

Pregnant wife: It feels weird not having the kids with us.

Me: Is this a date?

Wife:

Me: I’m counting this as a date.

Wife: *filling out forms* How much did I weigh pre-pregnancy?

Me: *guesses a weight*

*dies instantly under mysterious circumstances*

Me: I can't take it anymore. This hospital is like a prison.

Pregnant wife: We've been here 8 minutes

Me: *hacks at the wall with a spoon*

Pregnant wife: Hurry. We'll be late for my inducement.

Me: Relax. They can't start without you

Wife:

Me: Or maybe they can. I don't know.

Pregnant wife: Did you finish packing your small overnight bag for the hospital?

Me: Almost.

*jams in the Xbox*

My pregnant wife is getting induced today.

The agenda:

Hours 1-16: I'll live-tweet painful labor

Hour 17: New baby

Hour 18: Divorce

Thanks for the baby gifts @williamrodgers!

You're like the alcoholic uncle my kids never had. https://t.co/vCOlRfTJRG

Me: That song was by a band called Queen, not a real queen.

5: So there are no queens in the band?

Me: I’ll answer that when you’re older.

5-year-old: Dad! A spider!

Me: There’s no reason to be scared of something smaller than you.

5: Then why are you scared of Mom?

Touché.

5-year-old: I heard the queen today.

Me: What did she say?

5-year-old: We will rock you.

Coworker: What's it like having 3 daughters?

Me: Expensive. I have to set aside $20,000 per girl

Coworker: For weddings?

Me: Toilet paper

Two of my three daughters are currently crying.

So I'm doing one-third better than normal.

It's a good night.

Wife: Our 5-year-old said "fuck!"

Me: How is that my fault?

Wife: She saw it in your tweet

Me: Blame her school for teaching her to read.

5-year-old daughter: How come girls have babies & boys don't?

Me: That's just the way God made us

5: He probably knew you'd whine too much

Things Ben Carson believes:

1) The pyramids stored grain.

2) The Great Wall housed noodles.

3) The Statue of Liberty is full of Tic Tacs.

Pregnant wife: Help me up. I'm stuck on the couch.

Me: Not so scary now, are you? The tables have turned.

Wife:

Me: Please don't hurt me.

Me: *yelling at the TV* Don't go in there! You'll never make it out alive!

Wife: What scary movie are you watching?

Me: Our wedding video.

5 y.o.: Why do people congratulate you when Mom is the one making the baby?

Me: I helped

5: How?

Me:

5:

Me: I read her the instructions
2015: When people seriously gave a fuck if they got imaginary hearts or imaginary stars for imaginary validation.

Me: My wife wants this baby out

Doctor: Well there's a fun way to induce labor. *winks*

Me: Oh, I get it

*hides in a closet to scare her*

Me: Sex?

Wife: Touch me and they'll never find your body.

Me:

Wife:

Me: Just so I'm clear, would you murder me before or after the sex?

Remember, what happens on Twitter stays on Twitter.

And Facebook.

And Instagram.

And like a million other sites that steal your jokes.

Twitter,

Our demands are simple:

Change hearts back to stars

Add horseshoes, clovers & balloons

Put a prize at the bottom of every tweet

Pregnant wife: The doctor is going to check my cervix.

Me: Obviously.

Wife: Do you even know what that is?

Me: It's by the muffler.

I asked Twitter to pick a name for my baby.

Twitter chose Waffle.

This place is full of assholes.

I love you all.

Me: Hey! Your mom said no more Halloween candy today.

3-year-old: *hands me a Snickers bar*

Me: I didn't see anything.

Today is National Housewife Day AND Sandwich Day.

It's safe to say the man who scheduled those together didn't die from natural causes.

Me: Did you see the size of the spider I killed?!

Wife: Quit exaggerating and clean it up.

Me: Fine.

*grabs a shovel*

Wife: What's so bad about living with five girls?

Me: *fighting a shower hair clog so big it came to life* Nothing.

[driving]

Me: I actually liked that song. I wonder who sings it.

DJ: ...and that was a new hit by Justin Bieber.

Me: *drives off a cliff*

[middle of the night]

3-year-old: Dad!

Me: *wakes up* What?

3: Don't forget to buy pizza rolls.

Me:

3:

Me: *grabs my car keys*

The worst things you can find in your trick or treat basket:

3) razor blades

2) poison

1) banana-flavored candy

Me: I don't scare easily.

Pregnant wife: All four of our daughters will be teenagers at the same time.

Me: *never stops screaming*

Me: Sometimes I think you're only happy when I'm wrong.

Wife: So you're saying I'm always happy?

I let my kids eat Halloween candy for breakfast because I wanted Halloween candy for breakfast.

I’ve got this parenting thing figured out.

I told my 1-year-old she couldn't open any candy yet.

She ate a Tootsie Roll with the wrapper still on it.

That kid is a problem solver.

[trick or treating]

3-year-old: *gets candy from a house*

Me: What do you say?

3-year-old: See you tomorrow.
Say what you will about my parenting, but I'm raising my daughters right. https://t.co/z7jHVyyi6U

Pregnant wife: What should we name the baby?

Me: Let's ask Twitter

Wife:*death glare*

Me: I'll take that as a yes https://t.co/LNAT3vjxHY

My three kids scared the hell out of me on Halloween.

They reminded me that I have three kids.

My wife told me not to drink beer & play Xbox all day.

So I'm playing Xbox & throwing myself a wine & cheese party. https://t.co/xiKQFc1HoV

The weirdest thing happened to me when I logged off Twitter.

It’s called “sleep.”

It was kind of scary, and I’m never doing it again.

Me: She showed me her shoes, and I said they were nice.

Wife: Just "nice?"

Me: I'll go apologize.

Me: Are you surprised I like kids?

Him: I'm surprised you had sex.

Me: *takes a can of tuna from the pantry*

Me: Fish.

3:

Me:

[Walking Dead]

Rick: By being a main character

*walks out unharmed while zombies eat everyone*

[watching "Peter Pan"]

5-year-old daughter: What are people called who never grow up?

My wife: Men.
Slasher movies would be much more believable if the first person to get stabbed was always the guy who wouldn't shut up about CrossFit.

Me: Don't run in the house.

3-year-old: I can't help it. My shoes are fast.

I had to let her go. I'm not dad of the laws of physics.

5-year-old: You never wash your car

Me: It's pointless. It's just going to get dirty again

5: So why do you make me take baths?

Checkmate

Me: Say worst. Worstest isn't a word.

3-year-old: Yes it is. It sounds gooder.

Me: Do you want me to just cut off your hair?

5: Do you want me to cut off your hand?

Rick: Me, you, and the new guy no one's ever met

New guy: I've got a good feeling about this

3-year-old: Hey, Dad.

Me: What?

3: I hope sharks don't eat your face.

Me:

3:

Me: Me, too, kid. Me, too.
There were Civil War soldiers who had limbs amputated without anesthetic and still cried less than my 3-year-old when I brush her hair.
If I ever open a pizza restaurant, anyone who orders a vegan pizza will just get a regular pizza with pepperoni that spells out "Fuck you."

3-year-old: *licks the cream out of an Oreo*

*hands the two sides to me*

Me: What do you think you’re doing?

3: It’s called teamwork.

Me: *stares blankly at the router* What's our password?

Wife: All our kids birthdays in a row.

Me: Oh yeah

*stares blankly at the router*

"Hi, my name is-"

*gets eaten by a zombie*

--every new character on "The Walking Dead"

2)

*clicks link*

*finds out it’s a slideshow*

*throws computer out the window*

5-year-old: A double French braid twirled into a bun.

Me: No problem.

*ties her hair in a fishing knot*

5: 8:33 AM

Me: Aw. His first dick pic.

My kids change their minds so quickly

One second they love me throwing them in the air and the next second they hate it

Stupid ceiling fan

Me: The Internet.

Me: *playing video games* The dishes.

Me: This is a bad neighborhood.

Surgeon: *frantically rearranging the face on Mr. Potato Head* I’m still practicing.

Me: Why so serious?

3-year-old: I have preschool. I can't goof off all day like you.

Me: Yes. She did that.

5-year-old: Dad, can I-

Me: Do I have to get up?

5-year-old: No.

Me: Go for it.

Me: Don't you get bored hearing the same book again and again?.

*watches Star Wars trailer for 200th time*

[overheard on this playground]

Boy 1: God said a man can't marry a man.

Boy 2: He also said don't be a bitch, but that didn't stop you.

3-year-old: My friend's dad works on a farm.

Me: Do you know where I work?

3: That place that makes you sad.

Nailed it.

Hey @tbhjuststop,

Thanks for stealing my joke. Did you really think none of your 978,000 followers would tell me? https://t.co/S3bZnhJcda

*reads that Subway now guarantees all its 12-inch subs are actually 12 inches*

*takes a deep breath*

What a time to be alive.

Her: I won't let my son pretend dead people walk the earth
